fields.description:
The webwork.i18n.encoding property tells webwork what encoding to use. Currently, this is always UTF-8, which causes problems when the default confluence encoding is something else.

These need to be in sync.
fields.summary: Update the use of webwork.i18n.encoding to use the value of settingsManager.getDefaultEncoding().
Use nicer RSS URL
Add support for producing JSR-168 portlets of pages and embedding external portlets

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-4597].
  {panel}

From customer's email: 

Monty Solomon wrote:
> Downloaded attachments always have the date and time of downloading 
> instead of actual modification date of the file.
> 
> It would be useful if Confluence kept track of the actual modification 
> dates of attached files and provided that information in the header when 
> downloading attachments.
fields.summary: Attachments should be served with their modification dates preserved

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-4596].
  {panel}

Customer has requested the ability to be able to comment anonymously whilst being logged in.

Hopefully this will encourage more open and frank feedback.

This capability should be able to be turned on/off from the Conf or space level administration.

B
fields.summary: Add ability to comment anonymously whilst being logged in

fields.description:
I imported a few files from a local directory through your command "Import Pages from Disk" in the "Space Admin" menu. Confluence worked for a while then sent me to the alphabetical list of pages in my space. None of the newly imported files were here, so I thought the import failed. However, when I listed the recently edited pages, they were all here. I tried to change the title of one of these new pages, but it still did not make it to the alphabetical listing.

Perhaps you have solved this in the 2.0 RC2 ? Anyway I would like to try the 2.0 prerelease, how can I get it ?

Hope this helps,

  JFG

fields.description:
Confluence uses Seraph as its 3rd party authentication mechanism, providing a simple configurable way for SSO solutions to be plugged into Confluence. 

However, Confluence does make full use of the flexibility provided by Seraph. In particular, Confluence does not use the login.link.url property. Instead, login links are hard coded throughout the application. This means that any SSO solution that would like to update the login link needs to manually update the Confluence. This is no good.

We need to update Confluence to take its login link url from Seraph, allowing SSO solutions to configure the login page.
fields.summary: Improve SSO support: use seraph correctly to aid SSO modifications.
Migrate usages of PermissionCheckDispatcher to PermissionHelper

fields.description:
The navigational possibilities of labels would increase if one could filter by multiple labels. 

For instance, after you choose a label you get a list of pages that have that label. Ideally, if you had the ability to filter by additional labels, you would be able to winnow down that list, by choosing additional labels which are also assigned to these pages. Currently, that is not possible and information stored in those labels cannot assist a user while navigating. 

The potential uses of labels (or tags) in a wiki environment have not been fully explored. I think there is room for many innovations with labels. However, the inability to filter by multiple labels is a roadblock. 

In del.icio.us you can filter by multiple tags. Go to a user's page and choose one tag. Under the title "related tags" there is a list of tags that are attached to the same pages. You can add another tag to the filter by clicking on the "+" sign to the left of the tag. You can also remove a tag from the filter.
fields.summary: Filter by multiple labels
Flexible conditions for display of plugin help in notation guide

fields.description:
My catalina.out logfile is not almost 300M big after running for about 2 months.  It is filled with log entries like the following:

Nov 10, 2005 10:12:00 AM org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoader findResourceInternal
INFO: Illegal access: this web application instance has been stopped already.  Could not load bucket/event/jobs/TaskQueueFlushJob.properties.  The eventual following stack trace is caused by an error thrown for debugging purposes as well as to attempt to terminate the thread which caused the illegal access, and has no functional impact.
Nov 10, 2005 10:12:00 AM org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoader findResourceInternal
INFO: Illegal access: this web application instance has been stopped already.  Could not load bucket/event/jobs/TaskQueueFlushJob.properties.  The eventual following stack trace is caused by an error thrown for debugging purposes as well as to attempt to terminate the thread which caused the illegal access, and has no functional impact.
Nov 10, 2005 10:12:15 AM org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoader findResourceInternal
INFO: Illegal access: this web application instance has been stopped already.  Could not load com/atlassian/confluence/event/jobs/ReferralQueueFlushJob.properties.  The eventual following stack trace is caused by an error thrown for debugging purposes as well as to attempt to terminate the thread which caused the illegal access, and has no functional impact.
Nov 10, 2005 10:12:15 AM org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoader findResourceInternal
INFO: Illegal access: this web application instance has been stopped already.  Could not load com/atlassian/confluence/event/jobs/ReferralQueueFlushJob.properties.  The eventual following stack trace is caused by an error thrown for debugging purposes as well as to attempt to terminate the thread which caused the illegal access, and has no functional impact.
Nov 10, 2005 10:12:15 AM org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoader findResourceInternal
INFO: Illegal access: this web application instance has been stopped already.  Could not load com/atlassian/confluence/event/jobs/ReferralQueueFlushJob.properties.  The eventual following stack trace is caused by an error thrown for debugging purposes as well as to attempt to terminate the thread which caused the illegal access, and has no functional impact.

I searched for 'findResourceInternal' and 'QueueFlushJob.properties' on the Atlassian support page and jira pages, but could find nothing.

Since catalina.out is difficult to rotate, and the Tomcat docs seem to say "you shouldn't put stuff there ... use a logging lib that rotates instead of sending things to stdout", I'm feeling a bit stuck.  I don't want to have to log in a couple of times a year to stop/start Tomcat and manually delete this file.

I was surprised to not find anything on the Atlassian site about catalina.out -- am I the only person having an issue with this file growing huge?
fields.summary: Errors in catalina.out every 15 seconds about load error for TaskQueueFlushJob.properties

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-4572].
  {panel}

Currently, there is a single, globally-set thumbnail size that all thumbnails must adhere to. We should instead allow arbitrary thumbnail sizes.

/download/thumbnails/9999/image.jpg -- default thumbnail size (as before)
/download/thumbnails/9999/320x240/image.jpg -- 320x240 thumbnail size

And so on.

* Gallery macro and thumbnail properties for images will need to support the sizings
* We will need to periodically flush the thumbnail cache directory, though, since we could have an arbitrary number of thumbnail files per attachment.
* As it is now, the aspect ratio of the original image should be preserved - the 320x240 thumbnail should be the largest image that will fit into a 320x240 rectangle while preserving the original aspect ratio.
fields.summary: Allow arbitrary sized thumbnails

fields.description: When adding a new task to a {dynamictasklist} under Firefox, the page is refreshed automatically following a click on the Add button.  Same is not true when using {dynamictasklist} under IE6.  You have to explicitly refresh the page to see a new task added.
fields.summary: dynamictasklist does not refresh page after clicking Add under IE
Pluggable XWork Interceptors

fields.description:
At Codehaus we have quite a few users, and most of them have no correlation between their user id and their email - eg plonkplonk will have an email of jerry.clownfeet@smack.com

While I can construct the appropriate url to edit this user, this relies on me knowing the exact spelling. And I'm sure you'd agree that you'd rather not have me building URLs to use your product!


Thus, it would be handy if the search (under "Manage Users") also included any users that had a user id matching the search criteria.

Also on that note - the text next to the search field is misleading - "Users with email containing :" is not the whole story since it also searches the name fields.

(I think I have the same requirement of JIRA, but I'll raise that separately if it annoys me again!)
fields.summary: Add the ability to search for a user by user id

fields.description:
I use {section} macro to "layout large blocks of information clearly in Confluence" (the text is taken from Layout Macros description).

One of scenario I use is to divide the content space into several areas. After that I'd like to place content inside the area and it works fine except tables: when I place someting with || I have no borders. 

Surely, I can use {section:border=true) but this will show borders around section too which is not needed. Section just needed to make areas, and I don't need to make these areas with borders.

I think that {section} and | | should not correlate to each other. | | (tables) should always work as they should  - drawing borders.
fields.summary: Tables inside {section:border=false} has no border

fields.description:
Currently <code> and <pre> blocks in Confluence have no limits set on content that overflows the normal page width.  Consequently blocks with long lines of text can push the width of the entire web page to an arbitrary width.  The user must scroll horizontally to read every line on the page, or to access navigational links on the right side.

Fortunately the fix is easy: add "pre, code { overflow: auto; }" to the CSS for Confluence.  This tiny CSS snippet will add a horizontal scrollbar when a block contains a line that exceeds the normal block width.  All of the content in the block is still accessible and page widths don't blow up.
fields.summary: Add overflow control to pre and code blocks via CSS

REQ-186 Ability to use HSH-Monitor and Access Manager without admin rights at the server Sulzgruber Wolfgang Sulzgruber Wolfgang PPC Clarification UNRESOLVED Nov 04, 2005 Nov 09, 2005

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-4563].
  {panel}

It would be nice if we had the following parameters (apologies if these have been added in a Confluence 2.x build):

* extensions = comma separated list of image extensions to include (default = all). Eg. I might just want to show .png's or .gif's
* size = override thumbnail size - I might want to show herds of images on a page so use a thumb size of 100px wheras another page might only have a small number of files so I might want them bigger, say 300px

(Yes, I know the thum size can be set in admin console, but it would be nice to be able to override it if necessary just for one page - or maybe even set a default on a space by space basis?)

Also, what image formats are supported?
fields.summary: New parameters for {gallery} macro

fields.description:
The Rich Text editor adds an extra instance of the user's name each time it's loaded.

To reproduce:

1) With the "Wiki Markup" view, add a user link (ie. [~jdoe])
2) Go back to the "Rich Text" view
3) Click Save
4) Notice that instead of saving the source as as "[~jdoe]", it saves it as "[~jdoe] John Doe"; this ends up rendering as "John Doe John Doe"

To see it even better, add the user link and then switch back and forth from "Wiki Markup" to "Rich Text," and watch it grow and grow.
fields.summary: WYSIWYG editor doesn't handle user links properly

fields.description:
Possible outputs are:

1) Display (implemented)
2) WYSIWYG (needs to be merged with existing mechanism)
3) Preview (implemented)
4) PDF export
5) HTML export
6) Email
7) RSS
8) No display

"No display" will be used when the renderer is drawing a page post-edit to extract links, and run the macros in case they need to update metadata - so display macros can just shortcut their output, especially macros that need to make external connections.
fields.summary: Add all possible rendering output types to PageContext#getOutputType()

fields.description:
Could the livesearch plug-in, listed here: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/XWork+Plugins , 
be modified so that it can be configured to only search a specific space. 

For example:
{livesearch|spacekey}
{livesearch}

Extending this idea, the plug-in should be able to do search for specific pages, document type, etc.
To start with, providing the ability to search a particular space would be really nice :)
fields.summary: Modifying livesearch plug-in to search by space, pages, documents.
Update Commons-Lang to 2.0+

fields.description:
I just realized this, but after importing all the jspwiki spaces we had, nearly all (possibly all?) the pages in each space are listed as orphan, though they are easy to navigate to using normal wiki links from the space home page.

Is this because there was no homepage set when the import happened, so no page was technically reachable (even though that could have been reduced to a single unreachable page - the unspecified home page), or is that no orphan/non-orphan investigation is done on import?

More importantly, how can I get confluence to re-scan everything? Would a confluence-level export / import fix things?

I have stopped and restarted confluence, and I have re-indexed and those didn't help.
fields.summary: Importing from jspwiki-exporter results in nearly all (all?) pages being "orphaned"
Double-click to edit
Complex headings generate invalid anchors
Long noformat content & scrollbars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-4538].
{panel}
Consider this: while I am a long time wiki user, when presented with an empty space I still waste quite a lot of time in getting a space to the right structure. Adding MeetingNotes pages, adding templates, experimenting, fighting with macros etc.

My work and productivity would have been ten-fold better had I been able to select from a space gallery that Atlasian or people in a similar setting have created and posted. I can practically hit the ground running.

This should be a tremendous sales booster. I am currently evaluating this product and am working hard with an extremely tight schedule to get the management to buy in (other options being evaluated include Jot and SharePoint). Such a feature would have made a difference.

 
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of December, 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi all,

Thank you for taking the time to comment and vote on this suggestion.

We fully appreciate the need to create space templates, and understand the value this feature would bring. While it is something we would like to investigate further in the future, we have no current plans to commit this to our roadmap.

While I’m sure this news is disappointing to many, we do currently surface a Space Blueprints API which will allow you to develop your own templates. For more information, check out our [developer documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/confdev/confluence-plugin-guide/confluence-blueprints/space-blueprints].

Alternatively, for those of you without developer expertise, we recommend using the existing copy page feature. Simply create your template as a page tree, and copy the page, including children, whenever you need to use it. See the [Confluence documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/copy-a-page-139013.html#CopyaPage-Copypages] for more information.

Best
 Jenny Millman | Product Manager - Confluence Server
{panel}
fields.summary: Creating a Space Template

fields.description:
the jspwiki-exporter had several minor problems with our jspwiki sites, and I thought I'd document them here so they could maybe be fixed for future jspwiki exporters. We're already done with our migration so I can't really test, but here they are anyway

1) multiple noformat sections. If you have a page with several '{{{ <text here> }}}' sections, the exporter only finds the first open token, and the last close token from the set, and wraps the whole chunk in noformat, failing to alter all the intervening formatted parts

2) uppercase / lowercase linking. This is a multi-bug which you could maybe log in the Wiki/HTML section of Confluence. Basically, if you have a link that has custom text then a link of 'Http://example.com' instead of 'http://example.com' confluence won't make it a link. The uppercase 'H' is the culprit. jspwiki-exporter should lower-case all links, or Confluence should realize that links are not case-sensitive until you get past the domain name

3) Shortcut links. The exporter doesn't move shortcut links around correctly such that they go from 'shortcut:phrase' to 'phrase@shortcut'. That was a lot of manual fixing...

Other than that, it worked great though - and we're talking about 25 or so spaces, hundreds of pages, and 400MB total once imported. Not bad!
fields.summary: jspwiki-exporter has a handful of minor bugs

fields.description:
I discovered this problem while migrating a page from Wikimedia which uses two square brackets for links instead of one.  Narrowed the bug down to the following.  Start with this:

[one]
[two]

Edit both links names such as this:

[one1]
[two2]

Revision history has two problems:

1) The revision of the second link doesn't even appear on the history page -- it's like it disappeared
2) The revision of the first link is displayed as a deleted line when it should show as a word change (add more text around each link to see this behavior)

Possibly unrelated, but on the page Info tag, the latest revision is not displayed in the Recent Changes box.  I have to click on "View page history" and manual compare the last two version to see the latest revision.
fields.summary: Revision not shown if links are changed on consecutive lines

fields.description:
If you try and view an email and have any parameters (e.g. highlighting an attachment), you get the following error message:

---
 The following error(s) occurred:

    * Unable to determine containing thread for mail with id: 0. This mail does not exist.
---

In fact, this occurs even if you put a '?' after the mail ID in the URL.

It seems to be related to the hack used for Orion in the MailPathConverter, which puts parameters into the action context when redirecting URLs. Why this only occurs when the '?' is present, I don't know.
fields.summary: Viewing mail with a parameter causes an error on Orion 2.0.2

fields.description:
The new feature would be a new field when creating a template which is "Default Page Title". If "select template" is chosen upon page-creation and no title is entered yet this default title will be used.

Background:

Currently creating a new space is a lot of work for me because I have a predefined structure for every space:

1. Home
1.1 Includes - Includes which might be used all over the space
1.1.1 Space Left Navigation - the navigation part for the Space-Homepage to decrease "scrolling" when you need to edit the contents of the Homepage
1.2 Space Relatives - Is used to render Space Left Navigation, Background: E. g. for a company with Sales-, Marketing. and R&D-dept. there are different spaces which all are "subspaces" of the "Company Space". To easily navigate from space to space I added them as part of the left navigation column of the space's homepage.
1.2.1 Child Spaces - contains subpages which are redirects to the other spaces
1.2.2 Parent Spaces - see Child Spaces
1.2.3 Sibling Spaces - see Child Spaces
1.3 Lost and Found - I personally like to have the pages with no parent very obvious available. This is due to the fact that the "Parent" field often clears while selecting a template page and thus leads to Orphaned Pages.

The names are mandatory as they are used in {include}-statements and it should help readers of that space to detect "administrative" pages. Therefore it would be really nice to have this Default Page Title-feature to prevent typos.
fields.summary: Add field for "Default Page Title" for Templates
Wiki Panel can not be linked to external address.

fields.description:
In the create/edit page, create a new field for "Short description". This information can then be used to render Description and Abstract Meta tags in HTML, as well as provide a better short description to use by the {index} plugin (whereas currently it is just grabbing a chunk of content data directly off the page, which is a bit of a hit-and-miss affair)

There could also be a separate "Keywords" field.

Better meta-tagging allows for better searchability and more relevant results, both internally (ie. by Confluence) as well as external search engines.

Confluence search could then also use a "Search brief descriptions only" to improve search speeds.
fields.summary: Meta tagging and improved indexing

fields.description:
It just became crystal clear -- the rich text markup editor is eeeevil!
 
In a flash, I realized that this piece of much requested featuredom has the potential to be the downfall of Confluence. :-(
 
What was the flash, the insight, the epiphany, that leads me to such a grim outlook, you ask?
 
It went like this:
"Oh geez, this effin' editor is effin' up my effin' simple wiki markup just like effin' Frontpage 1.0 and effin' MS Word used to do to my HTML!!!!!"
 
As soon as anyone edits simple pages with that beast, there will be all sorts of dreck --   slash \ escaped chars, extra spaces added where it wants them and I don't, newlines randomly stripped from where I wanted them.... human sacrifice, cats and dogs living together, mass hysteria!
 
Oh unhappy day. :-(
 
Please tell me that the rich editor can be turned on/off on a per space basis - pleeeease at least tell me that. ;-)
fields.summary: Enable/Disable WYSIWYG per space.
